maml:description.maml:para: Clears the run history from the synchronization service

The Clear-RunHistory cmdlet allows you to clear the Synchronization Service's run history. You can clear all runs, all runs older than a specified date, or all runs older than a specified number of days. The cmdlet also provides the ability to save the runs that are cleared to a file
Specifies the date of the latest run that will be deleted from the server. Runs after this specified date and time are preserved
The name of the file to save the runs to before they are cleared
Specifies the number of days of run history to keep
The name of the file to save the runs to before they are cleared
Specifies the number of days of run history to keep
Specifies the date of the latest run that will be deleted from the server. Runs after this specified date and time are preserved
The name of the file to save the runs to before they are cleared

maml:alert.maml:para: Saved run history files can be loaded using the Get-SavedRunHistory cmdlet

dev:remarks.maml:para: Using the Clear-RunHistory cmdlet with no parameters will clear the entire run history from the server

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Clear runs older than specified number of days --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears all items in the run history older than 2 days

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Clears run history older than the specified date --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Clears all runs older than January 1, 2016

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Clear the run history, saving the runs to a file --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnects a connector space object from the metaverse

The Disconnect-CSObject cmdlet allows you to disconnect a specified connector space object from the connector space. If disconnecting the connector space object will result in the metaverse object being deleted, the cmdlet will prompt for confirmation before proceeding.
The connector space object to disconnect
Specifies if the connector should be made an explicit disconnector. By default, a normal disconnector is made
The connector space object to disconnect
Specifies if the connector should be made an explicit disconnector. By default, a normal disconnector is made

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Disconnect a connector space object using the pipeline --------------------------
-------------------------- Explicitly disconnect a connector space object --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Exports a management agent to a file
The Export-ManagementAgent cmdlet exports a management agent to an XML file
The name of the file to export to
The name of the management agent to export
The name of the file to export to
The name of the management agent to export

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports the ADMA management agent to a file called 'ma.xml'

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the metaverse configuration to a file

The Export-MetaverseConfiguration cmdlet exports the metaverse XML files to an empty folder. These files can then later be used to import the metaverse confirmation using the Synchronization Service client.
An empty directory to export the configuration files to
An empty directory to export the configuration files to
Gets one or more connector space objects
The Get-CSObject cmdlet allows you to get one or more CSObjects using a connector space object ID, a DN, or an RDN
The connector space object ID
The management agent containing the connector space object
The distinguished name of the connector space object
Specifies that all objects contained below the specified DN should be returned
The management agent containing the connector space object
The relative distinguished name of the connector space object
The management agent containing the connector space object
The connector space object ID
The distinguished name of the connector space object
The relative distinguished name of the connector space object
Specifies that all objects contained below the specified DN should be returned
The management agent containing the connector space object
Gets the disconnectors from a specified agent
The Get-Disconnectors cmdlet allows you to get explict, filtered, and normal disconnectors from a management agent
The type of disconnector to get
The management agent to get the disconnectors from
The type of disconnector to get
The management agent to get the disconnectors from

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all disconnectors from a management agent --------------------------
-------------------------- Get filtered disconnectors from a management agent --------------------------
-------------------------- Get all explicit disconnectors from a management agent --------------------------
-------------------------- Get normal disconnectors from a management agent --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the last run details from the specified management agent
Gets the specified number of run history items from the management agent, starting with the most recent
The number of run history items to return (starting from the most recent). Leaving this value unspecified will return the last run history item
The management agent to get the run history for
The number of run history items to return (starting from the most recent). Leaving this value unspecified will return the last run history item
The management agent to get the run history for
Gets a management agent
The Get-ManagementAgent cmdlet gets the configuration details of the specified management agent
The name of the management agent
Forces the cmdlet discard any internal cached copy of the management agent, and reload it from the sync service
The name of the management agent
Forces the cmdlet discard any internal cached copy of the management agent, and reload it from the sync service
Gets the metaverse configuration
The Get-MVConfiguration cmdlet gets the configuration settings from the metaverse including the schema, object deletion rules, password synchronization configuration, and provisioning configuration

dev:remarks.maml:para: Schema : Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.DsmlSchema Version : 436 PasswordSyncEnabled : True PasswordChangeHistorySize : 24 RulesExtension : FIM.MRE.dll RulesExtensionInSeperateProcess : False RulesExtensionTimeout : 60 ProvisioningRulesExtensionEnabled : True ProvisioningSyncRulesEnabled : False ImportFlowSets : {[group, group], [user, user], [contact, contact], [organizationalUnit, organizationalUnit]...} MVDeletionRules : {[calendar, Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.MVDeletionRule], [detectedRuleEntry, Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.MVDeletionRule], [expectedRuleEntry, Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.MVDeletionRule], [contact, Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.MVDeletionRule]...}

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more objects from the metaverse
The Get-MVObject cmdlet allows you to get one or more objects from the metaverse using either search criteria or a known metaverse object ID
The object type to query for
The name of the attribute to search with
The value to search with
The object ID of the metaverse object to retrieve
The object type to query for
One or more queries to use for advanced searching. The query is constructed using AND conditions between the query items
The database collation to use in the search. By default, the value is 'SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS'
The object type to query for
The name of the attribute to search with
The value to search with
The object ID of the metaverse object to retrieve
One or more queries to use for advanced searching. The query is constructed using AND conditions between the query items
The database collation to use in the search. By default, the value is 'SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get metaverse objects matching an account name --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Searches the metaverse for an object of type 'user' with an accountName of 'jsmith'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all metaverse objects matching an attribute value --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all metaverse objects of the 'user' object type with an accountType attribute value of 'custom'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Gets metaverse objects with account names starting with 'test' --------------------------
-------------------------- Get metaverse objects matching advanced criteria --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-MVQuery -Attribute accountName -Operator StartsWith -Value "test" | New-MVQuery -Attribute department -Operator IsPresent | Get-MVObject
$queries = @(); $queries += New-MVQuery -Attribute accountName -Operator StartsWith -Value "test" $queries += New-MVQuery -Attribute department -Operator IsPresent Get-MVObject -Queries $queries

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all metaverse objects that have accountNames starting with 'test' and have a department attribute present. The example shows two ways of performing the query, using the pipeline, as well as using an array.
See the help on the New-MVQuery cmdlet for more information on search parameters

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the metaverse schema
Gets a list of the object types and attributes that are defined in the metaverse
Gets the schema for the specified metaverse object type only
Gets the schema for the specified metaverse object type only

dev:remarks.maml:para: ObjectClasses Attributes ------------- ---------- {[placeholder, placeholder], [sharedMailbox, sharedMailbox], [calendar,... {[accountBlocked, accountBlocked], [accountDisabled, accountDisabled], ...

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Gets the schema for a specific metaverse object type --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name Attributes ---- ---------- user {[accountBlocked, accountBlocked], [accountDisabled, accountDisabled], ...

maml:description.maml:para: Gets connector space objects that are pending export add operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending export add operations. These are objects that will be created in the connected system on the next export.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Gets connector space objects that are pending export delete operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending export delete operations. These are objects that will be deleted in the connected system on the next export.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Gets connector space objects that are pending export rename operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending export rename operations. These are objects that will be renamed in the connected system on the next export
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Gets connector space objects that are pending export operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending export operations
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Gets connector space objects that are pending export update operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending export update operations. These are objects that will be modified in the connected system on the next export.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Gets connector space objects that are pending import add operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending import add operations. These are objects are newly seen in the connector space, and have not yet been synchronized.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
Gets connector space objects that are pending import delete operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending import delete operations. These are objects were seen as deleted in the last import, but have not yet been synchronized.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
Gets connector space objects that are pending import update operations
Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending import update operations. These are objects were seen as modified in the last import, but have not yet been synchronized.
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
The management agent to get the pending objects from
The management agent to get the pending objects from
Specifies to get only the changes being made to the object
Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
Gets detailed information about a management agent run
The Get-RunDetail cmdlet gets the details from a specific management agent run. The cmdlet can get the details based on the run number, or using a RunSummary object
The number of the run to obtain the details of
The management agent to get the run detail from
The run summary item to get the detail for
The management agent to get the run detail from
The number of the run to obtain the details of
The run summary item to get the detail for
The management agent to get the run detail from
Gets a summary of runs for the specified management agent

The Get-RunSummary cmdlet gets a collection of RunSummary items that describe basic information about the run on the management agent. For further details, pass the RunSummary object to the Get-RunDetail cmdlet to get the full details of the run.
The management agent to get the run summary from
The management agent to get the run summary from

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get detailed run information from a summary item --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Joins a connector space object to a metaverse object
The Join-CSObject cmdlet allows you to join a connector space object to an existing metaverse object.
The object type of the metaverse object specified by the MVObjectID parameter
The ID of the metaverse object to join
The connector space object to join
The metaverse object to join
The connector space object to join
The object type of the metaverse object specified by the MVObjectID parameter
The ID of the metaverse object to join
The connector space object to join
The metaverse object to join

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Join a connector space object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $cs = Get-CSObject -RDN "cn=John Smith" -MA "ADMA" $mv = Get-MVObject -ObjectType user -Attribute accountName -Value jsmith Join-CSObject -CSObject $cs -MVObject $mv

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets a connector space object from the ADMA with a RDN of 'John Smith' and joins it to the metaverse object of type user, with the accountName of 'jsmith'

maml:description.maml:para: Project a connector space object
The New-MVObject cmdlet (or its alias Project-CSObject) allows you to project a connector space object into the metaverse as a new metaverse object of the specified type
The type of metaverse object to create
The connector space object to project
The type of metaverse object to create
The connector space object to project

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Project a connector space object using the Project-CSObject alias --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Defines a search criteria for use in a metaverse search
The New-MVQuery cmdlet creates an object that stores the criteria to use in a metaverse search. This cmdlet is used in conjunction with the Get-MVObject cmdlet
The name of the attribute to query
The operator to apply to the query
The value of the attribute to search for
Not used
The name of the attribute to query
The operator to apply to the query
The value of the attribute to search for
Not used

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets any object in the metaverse that has an accountName attribute starting with 'test'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Passing multiple MVQuery objects using the pipeline --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-MVQuery -Attribute accountName -Operator StartsWith -Value "test" | New-MVQuery -Attribute department -Operator IsPresent | Get-MVObject

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example gets all objects that have a value in their department attribute, and have an accountName that starts with 'test'

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Passing an MVQuery objects as parameters --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $queries = @(); $queries += New-MVQuery -Attribute accountName -Operator StartsWith -Value "test" $queries += New-MVQuery -Attribute department -Operator IsPresent Get-MVObject -Queries $queries

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example also gets all objects that have a value in their department attribute, and have an accountName that starts with 'test'

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the state of a disconnector
The Set-DisonnectorState cmdlet allows you to change the state of a disconnector from explicit to normal and vice versa
The disconnected connector space object to modify
The disconnector type to change to
The disconnected connector space object to modify
The disconnector type to change to

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Change a disconnector to an explicit disconnector --------------------------
-------------------------- Change an explicit disconnector to a normal disconnector --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Turns the provisioning rules extension on or off
The Set-MVProvisioningRulesExtension allows you to programmatically turn the metaverse provisioning rules extension on or off
Specifies if the provisioning rules extension should be enabled or disabled
Specifies if the provisioning rules extension should be enabled or disabled

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Turn the provisioning rules extension on --------------------------
-------------------------- Turn the provisioning rules extension off --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Starts a management agent run profile
The Start-Management agent cmdlet allows you to start a management run profile, either synchronously or asynchronously
The name of the run profile to execute
Starts the specified run profile asynchronously. The cmdlet will return immediately and not wait for the run to finish
Specifies that the last run should be resumed
Specifies that the progress bar should not be displayed
The management agent to execute
The name of the run profile to execute
Starts the specified run profile asynchronously. The cmdlet will return immediately and not wait for the run to finish
Specifies that the last run should be resumed
Specifies that the progress bar should not be displayed
The management agent to execute

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Starts a management agent, without displaying progress information --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Stops the execution of a management agent run profile
The Stop-ManagementAgent cmdlet stops any run in progress on the specified management agent
Specifies that the cmdlet should not wait for the stop operation to complete before returning
The management agent to stop
Specifies that the cmdlet should not wait for the stop operation to complete before returning
The management agent to stop
Performs a synchronization on a connector space object
The Sync-CSObject cmdlet allows you to show a synchronization preview of the result of a full or delta synchronization, and optionally commit those changes to the metaverse
The connector space object to synchronize
Specifies that the preview should be committed to the metaverse after being generated
Specifies that a delta synchronization should be performed. A full synchronization is performed unless this switch is specified
The connector space object to synchronize
Specifies that the preview should be committed to the metaverse after being generated
Specifies that a delta synchronization should be performed. A full synchronization is performed unless this switch is specified

dev:remarks.maml:para: The command show will perform a sync preview of the specified connector space object. The resulting preview information is returned and can then be inspected by further code.

CSOperation : disconnected MVOperation : disconnected CSObject : 14 MVObject : cfa22df7-ae07-e611-b778-005056b50bb9 ImportFlowRules : MVChanges : {CFA22DF7-AE07-E611-B778-005056B50BB9} JoinResult : ProvisioningResult : Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.ProvisioningResult MVDeletionDetails : dont-delete-wrong-ma AttributeRecalls : Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.MVRecall FilterRules : Lithnet.Miiserver.Client.FilterRules Exports : {d1a22df7-ae07-e611-b778-005056b50bb9, d0a22df7-ae07-e611-b778-005056b50bb9} Error :

maml:description.maml:para: Waits for a management agent run to complete
The Wait-Management agent cmdlet displays progress of the current run, and exits once the run has finished. If no run is in progress on the specified MA, then the cmdlet returns immediately
The management agent to wait on
The management agent to wait on

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Wait for a management agent to finish execution --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Wait-ManagementAgent ADMA write-host "The management agent has now completed"

The Get-Connectors cmdlet allows you to get explict and normal connectors from a management agent

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a management agent's run profile names
The Get-RunProfileNames returns a list of run profile names for the management agent. These names can be used in calls to the Start-ManagementAgent cmdlet

The management agent to get the run profile names from

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a collection of run history items that were saved to a file

The Get-SavedRunHistory cmdlet allows you to load a file containing saved run history items, created using this PowerShell module, or from the sync service itself, and load them back as RunDetail objects to allow easy searching and reporting
The name of the file to load
The name of the file to load

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example loads the run history from a file, then outputs the status for each run

maml:description.maml:para: Saves the run history from the synchronization service
The Save-RunHistory cmdlet allows you to save the run history in the sync engine to a file. To clear the run history, and optionally save the runs, use the Clear-RunHistory cmdlet
Specifies to save all runs before this date
The name of the file to save the runs to
Specifies to save all runs before this date
The name of the file to save the runs to

Gets all objects in the connector space that are pending import operations

Specifies to get only the representation of the object with the changes applied
